She can take care of herself. She doesn't need you.
Never know down there.  Helps to have a friend, sometimes.
How many sharks have you killed?
Me?  I don't know.  Twenty, thirty.  I love them, think they're the greatest. He walks away.  Mike looks out at the water, staring at it.
Young Mike Brody sees the lifeguard taken by the shark.
He comes out of it in a gasping sweat.
Well, how do I look? He turns.
What?
Wears an iron CHAIN LINK SUIT over her diving suit. She has a light-hearted nervousness.
Do you like it? She models it for him.
Oh, yeah.  Really nice.  Who's your designer?  Sassoon Shark?
I got it on sale. (touches links)
A real steel.
Here.
What's that?
Bracelets. It's what he's been welding.  Forearm protectors which he places on her.
Fine piece of engineering.
Should protect you a little, from the compression.  If that thing gets ahold of you.
Thank you. She kisses him.  He takes her in his arms.
Kathryn...
Yes? He looks at her.  Wants to tell her to take that damn suit off.  To get off this boat and forget the fucking shark.  To go home with him, to bed.
... I love you. She smiles.
Love you too. Mike nods and takes his beeper.
Okay, hit it.
The team of OPERATORS are at the instrument panel, all the monitor screens are on.  They flick some switches.
Let us know as soon as you have anything.
Right, Mike.
Like a flower of sunshine unfolding, lights pop on from beneath the water, illuminating the lagoon.
Mike and Kathryn watch the lights come on.
Wouldn't this whole thing be a little safer in the daytime?
It's easier to lure sharks at night.
Why?  'Cause they're hungrier?
They're always hungry.  They eat anything. Philip enters.  He's wearing a bright orange diving suit.
(continuing; touches her suit)
... even steel. Mike looks again at her protective suit.  She looks at Philip.
You look like an orange worm.
Shark bait.  Draws them over for closeups.
What in hell is that? She points to a
Strapped on his waist, right by his large knife.
Lunch for Whitey.  Something to munch on in case things get dicey.
We're taking that shark alive!
Let's hope he knows that.
I know it and I will not go down into this lagoon as long as you carry that!
Why?
Because I don't trust you, that's why.
You set that thing off down there, you don't know what will happen.
Precisely.
I insist you get rid of that bomb.
Afraid I can't do that.
You're supposed to film it, not turn it to hash!

Look, Doctor, this isn't one of your pet porpoises we're after. It's a torpedo of muscle. Murderous expertise!  I've seen bleeding sharks try to eat themselves!  Don't be so concerned about them.  Worry about yourself. He turns to go.
Hutton! He stops.  Turns.
You heard the lady.  Take it off. Tense pause.  Philip stares at Mike.  At Kathryn. Then his hand moves to the grenade.  He unclips it, holds it in his hand, and
Who catches it.  Philip walks away, smirking.  Mike makes a move after him, but Kathryn stops him.
One of the Operators sees something on a screen.  He focuses in on it.
It's the shark.
We see him, Mike.  Between the stadium and the ski show island.
All right, hit those lights too.
Start popping on.
Mike turns to Kathryn.  Tightens her tank straps. She holds a large SPEAR GUN.
Change your mind?
No.
You amaze me.  I'm more scared than you.
No, you're not. Mike pulls her face mask down and "kisses" her over it.  She goes over the side.
In their tanks and masks, ready to go.  Mike comes over to Philip.  Gives him back the grenade.
Here.  Don't let anything happen to her. Philip smiles and nods, clips the grenade to his waist and dives, taking us
Kathryn and Philip and Ike all start kicking down.
Watches the bubbles break the surface.  He turns to Shelly.
This is ridiculous.  We should blow the mother's head off.
Couldn't agree more.

As the three kick downward.  Philip and Ike prepare to film.  Kathryn notices Philip checking his power- head and reacts sharply.  He notices and gives her a mocking salute, making her angrier yet.  Turning, she starts toward the circling shark.

Intercutting between Kathryn, Philip and Ike and, on the deck of the workboat,  Mike and Shelly.  Kathryn moves toward the shark until it starts to circle her, Philip and Ike beginning to film. Her expert maneuvering is not lost on Philip, and he watches with interest -- Mike, on the boat deck, watches what he can with apprehension -- as Kathryn slowly lures the shark toward her. Suddenly, it darts in at her and she jabs the spear at it (into the audience), causing it to veer away. Kathryn seems surprised by this.  The shark begins to circle her again, CAMERA PANNING with her as she keeps an eye on it.  Philip and Ike keep filming, Mike keeps watching tensely on the deck as Kathryn positions herself, holding the spear extended, moving it back and forth. Abruptly, the shark darts in, moving so precipitously that it goes all the way to Kathryn.  She ducks and the shark's jaws clamp shut on her air tanks.  Philip reacts to this and starts forward to help her as the shark begins to shake her violently from side to side. Letting go of the spear, she tries to hit the shark in the eye but has no success.  Philip shows up, and she waves him off.  He cannot believe her reaction but doesn't draw his powerhead, only hitting the shark on the head with the camera.  This makes it let go of Kathryn's tanks and back off fast.  Philip shoving it aside as it passes him, drawing his powerhead just to be safe.  The shark does not attack him though, but retreats.  Philip looks at Kathryn.  She is shaken up, but the chain-mail suit has protected her from injury. She waves him back irritably.  Shaking his head either at her or her stupidity, he backs off to Ike, keeping a wary eye on the shark as Kathryn kicks up to the surface to get another spear.  On deck, Mike tries to speak to her as she grabs the spear, but she is under again before he can say a word.  Kathryn grimly sets herself again.  Seeing this, Philip casts his eyes heavenward, as though thinking, "Dear God, the woman's suicidal."  She jabs the spear toward the still lingering shark.  Finally, after making a few nervous passes, it goes for her.  This time, she is able to shoot the sedating spearhead into its stomach, then kicks up toward the surface as fast as she can, the shark starting after her.
As she breaks through.

Michael! Mike and Shelly rush there, reach down, and grab her hands to haul her up.  As they do, the shark comes after her.  They yank her over the railing an instant before it lunges out of the water and almost bites her feet off, jaws slamming shut in close shot as it misses, its body crashing back into the water. Kathryn looks at Mike, her face decidedly pale.  She attempts to smile.
(meekly)
...  I told you I'd get it. The shark bellies up.
I can use a shot of what he's got.
... Me, too. Her legs go watery, and she leans against the railing. Mike embraces her.

The roof has been opened, and the shark is being lowered into the room on the litter.  CAMERA DOWNPANS with it to reveal Brian and Ruth preparing to get the shark into the tank, Philip, Shelly, and Ike filming it.
He is drying her off with a large towel, rubbing her down good.  She is cold and shivering.
After this has opened, when everything's settled down, you and I are going away.  Just the two of us.  No dolphins, no sharks, no whales, no penguins. Just you and me.
Sounds wonderful.
We'll go to Palm Springs, Death Valley, Arizona desert, anyplace where there's no water. She kisses him and turns at a familiar SOUND.
In an adjoining tank, curiously watch the shark being lowered.  The dolphins chatter away.  Kathryn tells them:
Don't be afraid, it's okay now. The dolphins don't believe her.  They dive for safety.
Smiling.  She shrugs off the towel as Brian calls her.
We're ready for you.
I have to walk him till the drug wears off.
You want me to stay?
(kissing)
Get some sleep.  And tell Sean I'm sorry.
(remembering)
Sean, that's right... Mike turns to leave, accidentally crossing in front of Philip's shot.
Watch it, Brody.  You're ruining the shot.

Kind of dull in there for you, isn't it?  Why don't you throw in another shark? He walks out. Kathryn hurries into the tank with Brian and Ruth. They unfasten the shark from the litter and start to walk it.  The litter is raised back up.
He's a young one.
And big for his age. They walk on.
Sean and Kelly are lying on the ground making out as Mike's voice comes over the park P.A. system.
Sean.  Sean, where are you?
Someone's looking for you.
That's Mike.  Let him look. He kisses her some more.
Sean?  You there? Kelly gets to her feet, pulling Sean up too.
Come on, it's getting late, and I have an early call. They walk off, arms around each other.
Ruth sleeps on a floor mat.  Kathryn and Brian are still walking the shark.  Both look very tired.
Why don't you take a rest, Brian?
I'm only walking him.  You caught him.  You have to be exhausted.
Go on, you're tired.
No, I'm fine, thanks. They stop talking, keep walking.
Comes in, wearing his jogging suit.
How's sleeping beauty?
Still sleeping.
Kiss him, maybe he'll turn into a frog.
(smiling)
Should be coming out of it soon.
Just watch it when he does. Philip lowers himself into the water and moves to Brian.  Taps him on the shoulder.
May I cut in? Brian looks over at Kathryn, who's about to say no, then nods it's okay.
He's all yours. Philip takes his place alongside the shark.  He smiles at Kathryn.
Could be a new dance...  Walking the Shark.
(smiling back)
Thanks for helping.
Not at all.
Why are you?
I like it when they wake up.
So do I.  But for different reasons.
And I like you. They keep walking it.
You were quite daring in capturing him.  Very skillful indeed.
Skillful?  I missed my first shot.
Some miss all their shots.
Somebody could have gotten hurt.
That's what life is, Doctor. Full of chances to hurt yourself, or somebody else.
You're a strange man, Mr. Hutton.
Philip.
Before, you were ready to feed this shark a hand grenade.  Now you're helping to nurse it back to life.
That's because I am the shark.
We're all from the sea, Mr. Hutton. Our destiny is linked to the fate of the oceans.  By continuing to destroy fish, man destroys himself.
The grenade's just to intimidate Whitey.  He knows I have it, so he watches out.  Same is true when I film lions, tigers, rhinos... She studies his smile.
I think that you and I are natural enemies.
And here I thought I was charming you. The shark quivers, showing signs of waking.
Hello.  I think his nap's over.
Get ready to go.
Believe me, I am.
(calls)
Brian, he's coming around! They walk it a little more and
Comes INSTANTLY back to life with an EXPLOSIVE recovery. Kathryn and Philip leap aside to get out of there, but the shark SLAMS Kathryn against the side of the tank, knocking the breath out of her.

So does Brian, who comes jumping into the tank.  Philip uses his feet to keep the shark away from Kathryn, but they both almost get CRUSHED by the body.  Philip flips her out of the tank as the shark comes lunging around at him.
Gets out of there just in time, as the shark just misses chomping his evacuating ass.  Brian's out of there safe.
Look down as the shark swims in rapid circles.
Well, Doctor.  You've got your shark.
Thanks to you. There's a near moment of tender contact between them. Philip smiles and nods at her and leaves, doing his best Bobby Darin.
(singing "Mack the Knife")
Oh when the shark bites, With his teeth, dear, Scarlet billows start to spread... She watches him with an intrigued smile.
Kathryn comes quietly in.  Starts undressing in the dark.  Mike softly speaks to her from the bed.
All well in the Kingdom of the Sea? She smiles and sits on the bed.
Finally.
How's your patient?
Recovering nicely.
Me, too. She falls into his arms, and they kiss.
Mmmm... you smell good.
(smiling)
You don't.
It's my new perfume.  Great White, the Man-Eater. She nibbles his ear, neck.  He pulls her down to him, they kiss passionately.

All is still and quiet.  A NOISE is heard from beneath the water.  A faint almost ROAR, and the water is shaken by a giant form that sends a wave rolling to the CAMERA.  Then, whatever it was turns and returns to the deep.  The surface of the water rocks and trembles.
They're in a feeding frenzy.  They rip, tear, chewing on tuna, each other.  Anything in the water.
Playful bastards, wouldn't you say?
Philip and Ike and Shelly watching the footage on a Moviola screen.  They drink beer and watch.
Brings back such pleasant memories.
Was a rather enjoyable afternoon, wasn't it?
You want to show this?
Absolutely.  The audience will stain their drawers. (smiles)
I did. He walks for the door.  Opens it.

Stands outside his EXHIBIT BOOTH, taking in the start of a new day.  There's photos and signs:  PHILIP HUTTON PRESENTS KILLERS OF THE DEEP.  There's books and T- shirts and toys too.  Ike joins him outside.
Gonna be a beautiful day.
And a profitable one. They smile at each other.
Come on,  I'll buy you breakfast.

As final last-minute preparations are made. A.  Mini-buses being washed and decorated. B.  Sea shows in final rehearsal. C.  The Skiers getting dressed. D.  The mini-sub being worked on at the dock. E.  Food trucks delivering. F.  The ushers and usherettes, looking good. G.  Divers reaching the lagoon. H.  Control Room Underwater -- all is ready for lift- off. I.  Maintenance crews washing, scrubbing, polishing.
Come up.  They shake their heads "nothing."  They dive again.
Activating one of the symbol controls again and again.
Mike and BOB talk.

We've been looking all night, Mike.  I don't think he's out there.  If he drowned, I think he went down on the bay side of the gate and the current pulled him out.  It was pretty strong when the men were working there.
Did you look in the intake passage?
You can't even get in there, the incoming flow is so strong.  It would wash the body out anyway.
Well, I don't know.  Maybe he isn't down there.  Keep checking with everyone who knows him. I'll be at my office. He leaves.
Mike's walking as Kathryn comes from the other side.
Mike! He turns and she skips up to him.
(continuing)
They said you'd be here.
What's up?
I need more pressure in the shark tank.
Okay.
I want to make sure the White is getting enough flow.  Would you do that for me?
Sure.  Let's go. She stops him.
No, we'll go through here.
... Mean through the tubes?
Yes.  It's faster. MIKE
No,  I'm not going through there.
Michael, come on, don't be silly. This is the quickest way.  You're not going to walk all the way around?
I'm not going to walk through that shark arcade.
They're not going to hurt you. They're encased in plastic.
I don't want to see them, Kathryn.
Michael, I don't have time. Please!  It's time you dealt with this and got over it.  Now come on! She takes his hand and leads him into the tunnel.
Mike is very apprehensive as the SHARKS encroach upon them from all angles.  He can't look at them.
Calvin wants me to move the White for tomorrow.
... He ought to put him in here.
It's too soon to move him.
So tell Calvin.
I did.  He wants it on exhibit.
Well, that's why you got it. They walk on a bit, then Mike leans against the tunnel wall, eyes closed.
Mike... you okay? He's taking deep breaths.  He's very pale and perspiring.
It's back... She goes to him.
What's back? He's fighting some inner demon, and losing.  The sharks come swimming by him.  He stares them in the eye.  There seems to be thousands of them.
Honey, what is it?
Hydrophobia...
Michael, take deep breaths.
I have to get out of here.
Come on.
I can't take water, Kathryn.
Yes, you can.

I can't!  My dad had it, and I don't know if you can inherit it or what, but I got it, and I hate it.  I can't stand it! He RUNS out of there, running for his life, leaving her behind.  She watches him go.

head_text.subj: MOVE FROM THEM THROUGH THE WINDOW

text: Out into the water.  A shark.  We move in on its black eye, till the eye fills the SCREEN.

The same size as the eye in the previous shot, ROARING as the cannon is fired.  CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal the cannon on the deck of a motorized pirate vessel which is carrying on its deck a gathering of politicians, press representatives, TV newsmen, and celebrities.  It sails across the lagoon, flags whipping in the wind, cannons THUNDERING.  CAMERA PANS UP and we see the words THE NEW SEA KINGDOM WELCOMES YOU moving across the sky, towed by a single-engine plane.
The great American Tourist invasion.  They come in cut- offs and sandals, Kodaks and sunglasses.  They come in every size, shape, and colored getup.  Old and young, they CHARGE.
Welcome to Sea Kingdom, and the excitement and discovery of earth's inner space.  For the whale and dolphin shows, please stay to the right.  The underwater tunnels are straight ahead...
Very pretty in their fishtail suits.  They answer the tourists' questions.
As we come floating over the park.
Dangling out of the HOT AIR BALLOON, filming.  Ike is the pilot.
Hardly like the Falklands. Philip calls over the bullhorn to the gaping tourists below:
If you'll all squeeze a bit closer, everybody, you can see yourself tonight on the evening news.
A 200-pounder in shorts, hat, and sunglasses squeezes into the shot.  She looks up, smiling and waving at the hot air balloon.  She shoves in closer, loses her balance, and falls into the lagoon.
Watches woman splashing about.
Well, seems a new whale show has been added. They laugh.
She's scared of the performing WALRUS.  Her mother comforts her.
Come BURSTING through the sign like John Madden in the Lite Beer commercial.  The skiers are in their pyramid formation.
As usual, is fighting for balance.  Teetering on the edge, she lets out a desperate warning cry.
I'm gonna fall, I'm gonna fall!
No, Kelly!  Jesus, you can't!
Ahh---  Ohhh----
Back, Kelly.  Lean back!
Ohhhhh shhhhiiiit. There she goes. No, she doesn't. Yes, she does. Nope, still up there. Hang on, Kel.
Applauding the skiers as they come zooming by in formation.
Make their sweeping turn and head in to shore.  They come neatly out of the pyramid.
Makes a graceful 3-point landing, gliding onto the dock.  She EXPLODES in joy, all bubbly and happy, thrilled at her accomplishment.
I did it,  I did it! She leaps on Tod, hugging him exuberantly.
Way to go, Kelly! You were great!
I knew I could do it! They all slap palms and give high-fives and hugs. Kelly is the center of the adulation.

head_text.subj: MONSTERS OF THE DEEP FUN TUNNEL

text: Everyone enjoying the scary walk.  We see the giant squid tentacles reaching over the glass.  Kids scream. Now it seems as if one tentacle has actually BROKEN THROUGH, but it's only an illusion.  An EEL flies out of a cave and charges.
Screaming, yelling, giggling as they react to the ravenous "monster."  The girls are LINDA, BECKY, and ALI.  They love it.
Moving happily along.  They eat, take pictures, push strollers.  Everybody's having fun.
Doing their act for the laughing, clapping crowd. Kathryn looks pleased.
All the gauges and dials and monitors registering.
Looks at one flashing gauge.  He calls his partner over.  They look a bit concerned as they check it.
She forces her way through those in line to see the live "Great White Shark."
Excuse me, sorry.  Let me through, please.  I have to get through!
Brian and Ruth are walking the shark.  The exhibit is PACKED with tourists, gaping down, watching.
Bursts through onto the floor, kicking her shoes off on the run.  She jumps into the tank.
When did this happen?
Ten minutes ago.
It hasn't adjusted.
Get the hose!  We've got to force more water through the gills and oxygenate him! Brian scampers out of the tank for the hose.
I knew it;  it's my fault.  We moved it too soon.
Don't blame yourself.
I should have never listened to Calvin. They walk the shark.
Kathryn...
... Goddamn it. The shark is dead.  It floats over, belly up.
Takes a painful moment, looking at the shark.
No one's ever done it before. It was a good try...
Not good enough.
We got it to live for ten hours. That's some kind of record. She turns from the shark and looks up at all the
Gaping down, taking pictures, grumbling.
Big deal. Let's get our money back.
Look, Mommy, the shark's dead.
Yes, dear.  Come on. They start to leave with the others.  Some still stare and wait.
The disappointment and disgust is evident.  Brian puts a comforting arm around her.
Don't feel bad.
(resigned)
Okay... Have them get it out of the tank. She climbs out of the tank.
The audience laughs.
It leaps and dives, having as good a time as the tourists.
The tourists going from one show to the next.
Mike and Sean stand to the side as the girls hurry past them, changing costumes.

Mike, this is fantastic.  I mean, you're responsible for building all this.  What a job you've done! Maybe I'll quit school and come down here and work with you. Brody Brothers Construction. We've always wanted to do that together.  Boat building.

It's not that easy.  Worked construction every summer to get through school.  Three years apprentice in the park's engineering department, and two years to build all this.  Finish school first, Sean.  Then make up your mind.  If you still want to work with me, we'll have plenty of time.
You and Kathryn gonna stay here?
This company's expanding.  They got parks in Texas, Ohio, California.  I think I'm gonna be going to Waco.
Well, Dad asked me to ask you this, about the wedding.  Is there any chance you and Kathryn will get married in Amity?
Tell Dad we're getting married in Las Vegas.  In one of those chapels.  He can meet us there.
(laughing)
Yeah, he'll really go for that.
It's all up to Kathryn.  Amity's fine with me if it's fine with her.
Sean! Sean looks over as he hears his name called.  Kelly's running over to them.
She still talking to you?
We're in love.
Sure.
No, really.  I've never met anyone like her before.  This is it.
Yeah, right.  That's what you said about Janet, and Beth, and Barbara --
Puppy love.  This time it's real! We can have a double wedding. Kelly is upon them.  She's in her warm-up suit and looks adorable.  Sean greets her with a hug and a kiss.
You were great out there!
Did you see me?!  Wasn't I terrific?
As always. They kiss again.  Kelly sees Mike.
Hi, Mike.
How you doing, Kelly?
(sniffling)
I'm Neo-Senephrened out.  Think I'm catching a cold.
Better than catching Sean's herpes. An astounded glare.
Herpes?
Why you sonuvabitch...
(leaving)
See you tonight. Mike smirks away as Kelly grabs Sean.
Sean, do you have herpes?
No.  Of course not.  Don't listen to him.  He's - he's... (laughing)
... my brother. They kiss.
I'm not in the next show.  What do you want to do? He looks at her and grins.
Besides that.
I don't know, what else is there?
(excitedly)
I know!  We can take the gondola ride!
The one that goes underwater?
Yes, it's great!
No, Kelly, I don't want to...
Come on, it's fun!
Not for me.  I don't go in the water, remember?
You're not in the water.  You're in a gondola.
No, think of something else.
Sean, this is ridiculous.  You're acting very immature.
I'm not acting!  I don't want to go in it, okay? She's dragging him by the hand.
Well, I do!  Time you got over this wet dream.  Nothing's gonna hurt you.  Now c'mon, we're going on it! He very reluctantly goes with her.
Kids and adults laughing and jumping at the creatures from the deep.
Linda, Becky, and Ali ask the ATTENDANT at the entrance.
Is this one scary?
No.  This one's fun.  You'll like it.
Oh, good.  Because the last one really scared us. They head into the tunnel.
The Woman Controller sees something on one of the monitors.
Did you see that?
What?
On monitor three.  Was a glimpse of something.
That?
Yes, there is goes.
It's disappeared. They wait and watch.
I'll have the guard look. She picks up the phone.
He's on the phone to Control.
I'll go check on it. He hangs up and starts down the tunnel.
Having a good time as a giant, mad-eyed squid appears with all its tentacles reaching.
Wow, look at that!
Yeah.  Reminds me of my date last night.
Hey, look at that thing over there.  What's that supposed to be? They press to the glass for a closer look.  We see some kind of FORM, floating.
I don't know.  Some kind of crab?
It looks like a man.
It is!
Rolls over as the girls SCREAM in horror.  We see it is
What's left of him.
Mike sits at the bar, on a stool.  He's had a few, and it shows.  There's a good crowd in the restaurant.
Move for a spot.  Philip spots Mike.
See you later, mates. Philip moves over to Mike.
Philip puts an arm around Mike.
Your friend Overman picked a hell of a time to come back.
Yeah, poor bastard.
I lost a good cameraman in Australia last year.  A Great White chopped him in half with one bite.
Hey, I don't want to hear.
That's how they do it, you know. Seizes its prey and shakes its body savagely.  Teeth gnaw through a man like a buzz saw.
Buzz off.
I will, old boy, tomorrow.  Our work is done here.  Just came to say goodbye, and good luck.
Yeah?  Well, in that case, have a drink.
Thanks. (to girl bartender)
Bullshot.
So where you go off to, Hutton? Some expedition in New Guinea or Outer Mongolia?
No, South Georgia.
What the hell's there?
Polar bears.
Polar bears in Georgia???
South Georgia, Antarctica.
Oh...
The world's southern most reaches.
How come you're so brave with all this stuff?
Tradition.  Royal sense of adventure that's been in my family for centuries.  Dates back to the Crusades and King Richard.  What I was born to do.
Yeah, tradition's a bitch, ain't it?
Reach for the limit I always say.
I'll remember that, my Lordship.
She takes a beat, looks around, and moves quickly to the bar.
Michael. They both look at her as she comes up to them.
Michael, look at this. She shows us what's in her hand.
Mike looks at it.
Put it under your pillow and sleep on it and the tooth fairy will --
It's a shark's tooth!
So?
It was removed from Charlie Overman's body.
May I? He takes the tooth.  One look and he knows.
... The bigger to eat you with. He and Kathryn exchange an understanding that Mike doesn't.
(confused)
What's the big deal?  A shark got Overman, and we got the shark.
That's just it, Michael.  We don't!
What do you mean, we don't?
This tooth is from another shark. A shark that could be 30 feet long!
Thirty feet???
Actually, thirty-five is probably more accurate.
That's impossible.  If it's that big, why hasn't anybody seen it? Huh?  Tell me that.  It's like not seeing the Goodyear blimp in a swimming pool.
That's what I've come to ask you. Is there any large place that has a strong current of water flowing?
I don't understand. His BEEPER starts signaling.  He ignores it.
Sharks have to keep moving.  They can never stop or they'll suffocate. If water isn't always flowing through them, they'll die.
Is there such a place?  A cave or something with such a flow?
I don't know...  I can't think offhand of one. He reaches for his signaling beeper.
Yeah, what is it?
The Woman Controller is watching one of the rising gauges.
Mike, we got a heat build-up in filter system number four.  We're running high temperature.
Switch to intake three and keep it there.
Right, Mike.
MOVING - CAMERA PANS across the gate.  The bubbles stop.  Through the grate, we SEE the GRAY FORM begin to move.
What did you just say before? About water flowing through them?
That's why they're always moving. They have to have it.
(to Philip)
You wanted to know about a cave?
Filter system number four.  Is it large enough?
(solemnly)
It's large enough...
A dark cloud passing overhead, covering them in shadows.  We see the underside of a massive white shark.
How far away is filter number four?
Five hundred yards.
You have a man near it?
Somebody better get down there!
It's all controlled from the Control Room.
I've heard of a White that big, in Australia...
